main.title: Portfolio Website Builder Framework
main.description: A modular, component-based framework for building dynamic portfolio websites. Features a dictionary-driven architecture, hash-based navigation, dynamic content loading, and a comprehensive theming system with light/dark mode support.

main.content:
This framework was built to solve the challenge of creating **maintainable, scalable portfolio websites** without relying on heavy frontend frameworks or complex build systems.

The core philosophy is {{highlight}}configuration over code{{/highlight}} - content changes happen through JSON files, not code modifications. This makes it easy to add new pages, components, and profiles without touching the underlying system.

The framework uses a **dictionary-driven architecture** where all data flows through a unified structure:

- `entry.json` defines which profile to load
- Profile JSON lists the site layout and pages to include
- Page JSONs define containers and components with inline data
- The builder processes this dictionary and renders HTML

This separation means you can swap entire profiles, add new pages, or modify content without changing any PHP or JavaScript code.

main.title: Dictionary Structure
main.description: The dictionary flows through the entire system, providing consistent data access at every layer.

main.content:
Every component is **completely self-contained** with its own:
- `*_structure_t1.html` - HTML template
- `*_style_t1.css` - Scoped styles using CSS variables
- `*_behavior_t1.js` - JavaScript with global exports
- `*_loader_t1.php` - PHP loader with three modes
- `*_schema_t1.json` - Data structure documentation

This isolation means components can be copied between projects without modification.

main.title: Three Loading Modes
main.description: Shell mode renders a lightweight placeholder, content mode returns just the data script, and full mode renders the complete component.

main.content:
The framework uses **hash-based navigation** with minimal URLs. Each component registers a navigation handler that responds to state changes.

URL format: `#elementId` or `#elementId/state?param=value`

When navigation occurs:
- Previous page components return to their default state
- New page components are shown with the requested state
- Dynamic content is loaded if needed
- Tab highlighting updates automatically based on `parentTab` attributes

main.title: Navigation Handler
main.description: Every component exports its navigation handler to the window object for the global navigator to discover.

main.content:
All styling uses **CSS custom properties** defined at the site level. Components never define colors directly - they reference variables like `var(--color-primary)` or `var(--spacing-4)`.

The theme automatically switches between light and dark modes using:
- `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)` for system preference
- `.theme-dark` class for manual override

This ensures {{highlight}}100% consistent theming{{/highlight}} across all components with zero effort.

main.title: CSS Variables Usage
main.description: Components use semantic variable names. The actual color values change based on the active theme.
